contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox French commune |name = Arques |image coat of arms = Blason Arques.svg |image = Ascenseur03.jpg |caption = Fontinettes boat lift |region = Nord-Pas-de-Calais |department = Pas-de-Calais |arrondissement = Saint-Omer |canton = Arques |INSEE = 62040 |postal code = 62510 |mayor = Joël Duquesnoy |term = 2008–2014 |intercommunality = Saint Omer |longitude = 2.3033 |latitude = 50.7361 |elevation m = 10 |elevation min m = 2 |elevation max m = 62 |area km2 = 22.41 |population = 9945 |population date = 2009 }} '''Arques''' is a [[Communes of France|commune]] in the [[Pas-de-Calais]] [[Departments of France|department]] in northern [[France]]. ==Geography== Arques is situated in the middle of the [[Nord-Pas-de-Calais]] region, 40 km from [[Calais]] and [[Dunkerque]], and 45 km from [[Boulogne-sur-Mer]]. It lies on the border of the departments of Pas-de-Calais and [[Nord (department)|Nord]]. The town is crossed by the [[Neufossé Canal]], which connects the rivers [[Aa River (France)|Aa]] and [[Leie|Lys]]. The commune also includes several lakes—Beauséjour, Arc-en-ciel, Malhôve, Batavia—and part of the forest of Rihout-Clairmarais. ==History== In the wake of the [[Battle of the Golden Spurs]] a battle was fought here in April 1303 between French and Flemish. The Flemish were victorious in the [[Battle of Arques (1303)]]. Arques is not to be confused with [[Arques-la-Bataille]], where the [[Battle of Arques (1589)]] took place. ==Population== {{Historical populations |align=left | 1793 | 1531 | 1800 | 1682 | 1806 | 1691 | 1821 | 1854 | 1831 | 2190 | 1836 | 2330 | 1841 | 2601 | 1846 | 2769 | 1851 | 2771 | 1856 | 2992 | 1861 | 3456 | 1866 | 3805 | 1872 | 4080 | 1876 | 4145 | 1881 | 4270 | 1886 | 4567 | 1891 | 4284 | 1896 | 4355 | 1901 | 4302 | 1906 | 4478 | 1911 | 4658 | 1921 | 4613 | 1926 | 4512 | 1931 | 4696 | 1936 | 5008 | 1946 | 5222 | 1954 | 5800 | 1962 | 7224 | 1968 | 8738 | 1975 | 10042 | 1982 | 9245 | 1990 | 9014 | 1999 | 9331 | 2006 | 9615 | 2009 | 9945 }} ==Economy== Arques is famous for its [[Lead crystal|crystal]] manufacture. It has been the headquarters of [[Arc International (tableware)|Arc International]], the largest manufacturer of glassware in the world, since its inception in the 19th century.
